alert.note: Alert for Spartanburg; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 9:17AM EST until January 11 at 3:39PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Laurens, Spartanburg and Union SC. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows remain elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 AM EST, After yesterday`s heavy rainfall, elevated flows continued to work through the Enoree River. As the day wears on, any flooding of low-lying areas near the river will diminish as the river returns to within it`s banks. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
